Ye rose-colour'd damsels attend</br>A swain with an innocent heart!</br>Your mercy to COLIN extend;</br>To COLIN, devoid of all art.
He once had a pocket that shone</br>With guineas most heavenly bright:</br>"Come, take them," he cry'd, "they're your own:"</br>The ladies he loves to delight!
You know with what fondness you run,</br>While his money so tempting remain'd;</br>And you know, how you made him your sun,</br>When from presents your shepherd refrain'd.
He went to the wake in the dale,</br>And bought you up ribbons a score:</br>He paid for the dance in the vale,</br>But now he is able no more.
Some pity bestow on the swain;</br>Compassion don't fail to advance;</br>Lest, angry, this should be his strain,</br>"He pipes not, so you will not dance."</br>
